verses.text: Woe to the crown of pride, to the drunkards of Ephraim, Whose glorious beauty \add is\add* a fading flower, Which \add are\add* on the head of the fat valleys of them that are overcome with wine.

Behold, the Lord hath a mighty and strong one, \add Which\add* as a tempest of hail \add and\add* a destroying storm, As a flood of mighty waters overflowing, Shall cast down to the earth with the hand.
The crown of pride, the drunkards of Ephraim, Shall be trodden under feet:

And the glorious beauty, which \add is\add* on the head of the fat valley, shall be a fading flower, \add And\add* as the hasty fruit before the summer; Which \add when\add* he that looketh upon it seeth, While it is yet in his hand he eateth it up.
In that day shall the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts be for a crown of glory, And for a diadem of beauty, unto the residue of his people,
And for a spirit of judgment to him that sitteth in judgment, And for strength to them that turn the battle to the gate.

But they also have erred through wine, and through strong drink are out of the way; The priest and the prophet have erred through strong drink, They are swallowed up of wine, they are out of the way through strong drink; They err in vision, they stumble \add in\add* judgment.
For all tables are full \add of\add* vomit \add and\add* filthiness, \add So that there is\add* no place \add clean\add*.
Whom shall he teach knowledge? And whom shall he make to understand doctrine? Them that are weaned from the milk, \add And\add* drawn from the breasts.
For precept \add must be\add* upon precept, precept upon precept; Line upon line, line upon line; Here a little, \add and\add* there a little:
For with stammering lips and another tongue Will he speak to this people.
To whom he said, This \add is\add* the rest \add wherewith\add* ye may cause the weary to rest; And this \add is\add* the refreshing: yet they would not hear.

But the word of the \sc Lord\sc* was unto them Precept upon precept, precept upon precept; Line upon line, line upon line; Here a little, \add and\add* there a little; That they might go, and fall backward, and be broken, And snared, and taken.
Wherefore hear the word of the \sc Lord\sc*, ye scornful men, That rule this people which \add is\add* in Jerusalem.

Because ye have said, We have made a covenant with death, And with hell are we at agreement; When the overflowing scourge shall pass through, it shall not come \add unto\add* us: For we have made lies our refuge, And under falsehood have we hid ourselves:
Therefore thus saith the Lord \sc God\sc*, Behold, I lay in Zion for a foundation a stone, A tried stone, a precious corner \add stone\add*, a sure foundation: He that believeth shall not make haste.
Judgment also will I lay to the line, And righteousness to the plummet: And the hail shall sweep away the refuge of lies, And the waters shall overflow the hiding place.
And your covenant with death shall be disannulled, And your agreement with hell shall not stand; When the overflowing scourge shall pass through, Then ye shall be trodden down by it.
From the time that it goeth forth it shall take you: For morning by morning shall it pass over, by day and by night: And it shall be a vexation only \add to\add* understand the report.
For the bed is shorter than that \add a man\add* can stretch himself \add on it:\add* And the covering narrower than that \add he\add* can wrap himself \add in it\add*.

For the \sc Lord\sc* shall rise up as \add in\add* mount Perazim, He shall be wroth as \add in\add* the valley of Gibeon, That \add he\add* may do his work, his strange work; And bring to pass his act, his strange act.
Now therefore be ye not mockers, Lest your bands be made strong: For I have heard from the Lord \sc God\sc* of hosts A consumption, even determined Upon the whole earth.
Give ye ear, and hear my voice; Hearken, and hear my speech.
Doth the plowman plow all day to sow? Doth he open and break the clods of his ground?
When he hath made plain the face thereof, Doth he not cast abroad the fitches, and scatter the cummin, And cast in the principal wheat And the appointed barley and the rye \add in\add* their place?
For his God doth instruct him to discretion, \add and\add* doth teach him.
For the fitches are not threshed with a threshing \add instrument\add*, Neither is a cart wheel turned about upon the cummin; But the fitches are beaten out with a staff, And the cummin with a rod.
Bread \add corn\add* is bruised; Because he will not ever be threshing it, Nor break \add it with\add* the wheel of his cart, Nor bruise it \add with\add* his horsemen.
This also cometh forth from the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts, Which is wonderful in counsel, \add and\add* excellent in working.
